intro: Brachystelma atacorense, commonly known as the Atacorensis stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowering stems produce small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, often blooming in late spring or early summer. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
